column4: I need to install ubuntu over an existing installation, but keep one of the directories completely untouched (/backup)
I need to install ubuntu over an existing installation, but keep one of the directories completely untouched (/backup)
I'll just blame you all if /backups gets deleted
the damn cd burner won't work
because the current linux installation won't boot
delete everything except /backups, then choose to keep existing data when you install
because I broke slackware trying to get the damn cd burner to work in the first place
yes, just remove everything except /backup, or fix the existing system with a live CD
all VERY important stuff (work related code, documents, etc)
just don't be impatient. 90%+ of all data is lost because people try quick fixes.
